She has said little these past days, watching you navigate the conspiracy's aftermath with the quiet attention she brings to all matters of state. The Polish and Hungarian knights you brought from Kraków are settled in Toledo, their presence a reminder that beyond this domestic turmoil, the great work awaits: Spring 1441, Serbia, the crusade that will define your reign.


The morning's correspondence lies on the table before you, still unsealed. The realm turns, even when its king is weary.
